instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message:
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board in last week which the customer told me was intermittently not charging. Was no green light on it at all. Found a problem with the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> (DCIN Pin3 was 3ohm short to ground when <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> was on board) which i've replaced and now getting the green light but it still wont start. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is pulsing between 13.3v and 2.5V. 

Cannot see any shorts on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and have replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> again now but still the same behaviour. 

Has anyone seen this before and knows which component is the likely culprit?

<SIGNAL>DC_IN</SIGNAL> voltage is 16.5V as I would expect now (it was 1V before changing the ISL originally)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message:
[QUOTE="CRC2018, post: 77575, member: 1547"]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is pulsing between 13.3v and 2.5V.
[/QUOTE]


This is typical of a current sensing issue. Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Measure between the pins, not to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Remove F7040 and check if get steady <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message:
Pins 17/18 - 3ohms
Pins 27/28 - 20ohms
Both measured at the ISL

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message: Right i've replaced the ISL again with another new chip and it's now making PPBUS and starts! The machine does however have another issue - when I disconnect the charger and reconnect it then the light comes orange on the charger but it doesn't start to charge the battery. If I SMC reset the system then it will start charging the battery again until I reconnect the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Won't start
threads.message: Check what happens when BIL is disconnected (J6955).
